result.execSummary:
The defendant Gordon L Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Registered Sex Offender Intentionally Photograph a Minor without Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.14(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs.  Bond to be applied and the remainder returned to the poster.
Comply with all conditions of his current probation.

Defendant Gordon L Miller in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Kryshak makes statements, withdraws motion and parties have stipulated to return the property. 
Atty Hess makes statements.  Indicates the computer is ready for pick up.  Was informed that no one ever came to pick the items up. 

BY THE COURT:  Parties have agreed to honor the stipulation and interim order of Aug 31, 2015. Motion is withdrawn and may be re-brought if necessary.
Motion hearing on August 10, 2017 at 11:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Gordon L Miller in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:41 a.m. case is called and appearances stated on the record.
This is a plea hearing.

Prosecutor states plea agreement.  
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.  Attorney Kryshak makes statement as to his probation hold.
Will plea to Ct. 2 of Information 
Defendant enters a plea of:  No Contest
Plea questionnaire was filed.  Defendant confirms signature on the Plea Questionnaire.
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. 
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).  Atty Kryshak makes a statement  For purposes of this hearing, they are agreeing.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty - Ct 2. 2	Registered Sex Offender Intentionally Photograph a Minor without Consent
Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

On the Motion of the State - cts 1, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10 and 11 are Dismissed and read-in.
No request for a PSI by either attorney.
Court is satisfied he is still on probation. The ATR is how the credit was calculated.
Court will not order a PSI

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kryshak makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Court agrees with the a

BY THE COURT:
Sentence withheld
**Probation - 3 years**
Conditions:
--Pay costs
--Comply with all conditions of his current probation

Should he be revoked- 
--195 days credit for time already served

Cost will be taken out of the bond and remainder returned to the poster.

ADA makes statement re: victim notification and feels victim rights were complied.

11:55 a.m. case is concluded.

Defendant Gordon L Miller in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:18 AM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Defendant enters pleas of NOT GUILTY to all counts.

Preliminary Hearing held 4/14/14
for Specific Judicial Assignment - Counsel to Finn
pursuant to Order for Specific Judicial Assignment from 1942 to 0568 dated 3/17/14
#1 - Wisconsin Dept of Corrections Offender Information

Defendant Gordon L Miller in court with attorney Gary J Kryshak. Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Isherwood makes statements re: substitution of judge.  
Atty Kryshak makes additional statements.  
Court indicates he does not have any reason to recuse himself in this case.  Court is not sure what will happen re: future Judge assigned.   Court will proceed with the preliminary hearing if parties agree to do so. 
Parties would like to proceed. 

Detective Zblewski is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Isherwood. 
Exhibit #1 is marked on behalf of the plaintiff and referred to. 
Atty Kryshak stipulates to the sex offender registry. 
Atty Isherwood moves for the admission of Exhibit #1. 
BY THE COURT:  Received. 

Cross exam by Atty Kryshak. 
Atty Kryshak makes arguments to the Court. 
Atty Isherwood makes arguments to the Court. 
Cross exam continues by Atty Kryshak. 

Atty Kryshak moves to dismiss and makes arguments in support of that motion. 
Atty Isherwood makes arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.  State is to file an information.  The Judge who is assigned to this case will need to hear all motions at a future date.  
Bond Continued.
to Dismiss

records.addlTxt: $5,000 cash bond:   No contact with Lincoln Center or be on premises of any schools with students under the age of 18 or contact with any minor children.  Defendant not to possess any electronic devices that can access the internet or any cameras.  Defendant may sign the bond and have 48 hours to post the $5,000.00
Adjourned initial appearance on March 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court calls case 2:15 p.m. Defendant Gordon L Miller in court with attorney Gary J Kryshak. Defendant Gordon L Miller in custody. Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Kryshak request Court to recuse itself as Judge Eagon was prosecutor.  Court will address bond today only.
ADA Isherwood request a high cash bond: No contact with Lincoln Center or any schools or any minor children.  Defendant not to possess any electronic devices that can access the internet or any cameras.
Atty Kryshak make statements and requests a lower cash bond or sig bond and is a resident.  Defendant is still on supervision.

BTC:  $5,000 cash bond:   No contact with Lincoln Center or be on premises of any schools with students under the age of 18 or contact with any minor children.  Defendant not to possess any electronic devices that can access the internet or any cameras.  Defendant may sign the bond and have 48 hours to post the $5,000.00

BTC: Judge Eagon recuses himself from this case and it be reassigned through the District to other than Judge's in Portage County.
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on March 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
